Member Function Documentation

bool ServerSystem::addAttribute ( std::string  newAttribute)

takes in a string with either only a new attribute name, or a new attribute name and a default value to fill that attribute with. returns boolean true if succeeds.

bool ServerSystem::addNewLogin ( std::string  newLogin)

takes in single delimited string containing username, password, and number representing admin status. returns boolean true if added, boolean false if failed to add.

bool ServerSystem::addNewResource ( std::string  newResource)

takes in string with delimiters, parses into vector and constructs new resource object with given values. return true if succeeds, false if bad data given.

if the number of fields given matches number of attributes, then given data already has an ID (and is thus read from file). else, it has no ID, and was input during runtime.

void ServerSystem::export ( )

is called if an admin makes changes to data then disconnects. exports all logins and resources to file.

std::vector< std::string > ServerSystem::getAttributeList ( )

takes in no arguments. returns vector of strings containing each current resource attribute.

std::string ServerSystem::getListOfLogins ( )

takes in no arguments. returns concatenated string of all user names and their admin status

int ServerSystem::login ( std::string  loginStr)

takes in string containing sent user name and password, parses and checks against all existing names and passwords. returns 0 for fail, 1 for user login, 3 for admin login

bool ServerSystem::modifyResource ( std::string  resourceData)

takes in string with delimiters containing all attribute values for a pre-existing resource (some fields are modified) if given resource ID is found, changes all values to match given data. returns 1 if success, 0 if failed.

std::vector< std::string > ServerSystem::parseStrToVector ( std::string  row,
char  delim 
)

Takes in a string and char delimiter, and returns a vector of strings seperated by the given delimiter.

int ServerSystem::removeAttribute ( std::string  toRemove)

takes a string containing the attribute to be removed. returns true if succeeds, false if fails.

bool ServerSystem::removeLogin ( std::string  toRemove)

takes in string containing username to be removed. searches existing users and returns true if found. returns bool false if not found.

bool ServerSystem::removeResource ( std::string  toRemove)

takes in string containing resourceID of a resource to be removed removes resource and returns boolean true if succeeded.

void ServerSystem::run ( )

handles the inital loading of logins and resources. once loaded, call acceptConnection which listens for client connection requests

std::vector< Resource * > ServerSystem::search ( std::string  attribute,
std::string  searchString 
)

takes in attribute to search by and string to search for. checks the given attribute of each resource for the full search string first, and then for each seperate word in the search string. returns vector of resource pointers containing search results.
